text:
Welcome to How To Cook That. I am Ann Reardon.
Today we are going to make some chocolate

peanut butter indulgence cupcakes.
Firstly we will make our chocolate ganache

frosting because that needs time to firm up.
To make your ganache all you need to do is

place your chocolate in a bowl, heat your
cream until it boils and then pour the cream

over the chocolate.
For all the recipe quantities that you need

for this ganache and also for the chocolate
cake just click on the link in the description

below the video to go to the blog howtocookthat.net
Once your cream has sat on your chocolate

for a couple of minutes it will haev started
to melt the chocolate. And you can just start

to stir that. At first it looks like it's
not going to combine but just keep stirring

and then you'll get a nice smooth chocolatey
mixture.

I like to add a spoonful of butter into that
when I'm using it on cupcakes and just again

stir that in until it's melted.
And then put that to one side. If you are

using it the next day you can just leave it
on the bench top to set up, but if you are

needing it quicker than that then just put
it in the fridge to firm up.
Leave the ganache in the fridge to firm.

To make you cupcakes you need to melt your
chocolate and your butter in a saucepan over

low heat or you can do that in the microwave
just until they're melted. Then pour that

into a bowl and add your sugar. Now just feel
your mixture with your finger if it is hot

allow it to cool and if it is only just warm
that's fine. You can add all the eggs at once

and mix it in.
Sift your flour, cocoa powder and baking powder

into the mixture and using a whisk mix well
until you have a smooth chocolatey batter.

To make it easier to pour into your cupcake
wrappers cleanly I like to put it into a jug.

And then pour it in and use a spoon to catch
the drips as you move to the next cupcake
wrapper and fill that one as well.

Place them in the oven until a knife inserted
into the middle comes out clean then allow
to cool completely.

Using a serrated knife cut out a small indent
in the centre of each cupcake.

And then take a spoonful of peanut butter
and put it into each hole.

Put your ganache in a ziplock bag, cut the
corner off it and pipe a swirl of ganache
on top.

If your ganache has been in the fridge it
may be too firm just leave it at room temperature

just to soften up.
Make sure you sprinkle some crushed peanuts
on top to identify them for people with allergies.

And they you can bite into the smooth chocolate
ganache and get a hit of peanut butter followed
by the beautiful moist chocolate cake.

Click on the banner at the banner at the top
for more videos from this channel and don't

forget to subscribe for more desserts cake
decorating and chocolate recipes.
[music by youtube.com/setsailtv]
